# unicorn/no-length-as-slice-end <Badge type="info" text="Restriction" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">üõ†Ô∏è</span> An auto-fix is available for this rule.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Disallow using `length` as the end argument of a `slice` call.

### Why is this bad?

Passing `length` as the end argument of a `slice` call is unnecessary and can be confusing.

### Example

Examples of **incorrect** code for this rule:

```javascript
foo.slice(1, foo.length);
```

Examples of **correct** code for this rule:

```javascript
foo.slice(1);
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny unicorn/no-length-as-slice-end
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "rules": {
    "unicorn/no-length-as-slice-end": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
